(id) + imageNamed: [implementation]

Detailed Description

CPImage is used to represent images in the Cappuccino framework. It supports loading all image types supported by the browser.

Delegate Methods

-(void)imageDidLoad:(CPImage)image; Called when the specified image has finished loading.

Parameters:
image the image that loaded

-(void)imageDidError:(CPImage)image; Called when the specified image had an error loading.

Parameters:
image the image with the loading error

-(void)imageDidAbort:(CPImage)image; Called when the image loading was aborted.

Parameters:
image the image that was aborted

- (id) initByReferencingFile: (CPString)  aFilename
size: (CGSize)  aSize 
[implementation]

Initializes the image, by associating it with a filename. The image denoted in aFilename is not actually loaded. It will be loaded once needed.

Parameters:
aFilename the file containing the image
aSize the image's size
Returns:
the initialized image

Definition at line 113 of file CPImage.j.

00114 {
00115     self = [super init];
00116 
00117     if (self)
00118     {
00119         _size = CPSizeCreateCopy(aSize);
00120         _filename = aFilename;
00121         _loadStatus = CPImageLoadStatusInitialized;
00122     }
00123 
00124     return self;
00125 }

- (id) initWithContentsOfFile: (CPString)  aFilename   [implementation]

Initializes the receiver with the contents of the specified image file. The method loads the data into memory.

Parameters:
aFilename the file name of the image
Returns:
the initialized image

- (void) load   [implementation]

Loads the image data from the file into memory. You should not call this method directly. Instead use one of the initializers.

Definition at line 254 of file CPImage.j.

00255 {
00256     if (_loadStatus == CPImageLoadStatusLoading || _loadStatus == CPImageLoadStatusCompleted)
00257         return;
00258 
00259     _loadStatus = CPImageLoadStatusLoading;
00260 
00261     _image = new Image();
00262 
00263     var isSynchronous = YES;
00264 
00265     // FIXME: We need a better/performance way of doing this.
00266     _image.onload = function ()
00267         {
00268             if (isSynchronous)
00269                 window.setTimeout(function() { [self _imageDidLoad]; }, 0);
00270             else
00271             {
00272                 [self _imageDidLoad];
00273                 [[CPRunLoop currentRunLoop] limitDateForMode:CPDefaultRunLoopMode];
00274             }
00275             [self _derefFromImage];
00276         }
00277 
00278     _image.onerror = function ()
00279         {
00280             if (isSynchronous)
00281                 window.setTimeout(function() { [self _imageDidError]; }, 0);
00282             else
00283             {
00284                 [self _imageDidError];
00285                 [[CPRunLoop currentRunLoop] limitDateForMode:CPDefaultRunLoopMode];
00286             }
00287             [self _derefFromImage];
00288         }
00289 
00290     _image.onabort = function ()
00291         {
00292             if (isSynchronous)
00293                 window.setTimeout(function() { [self _imageDidAbort]; }, 0);
00294             else
00295             {
00296                 [self _imageDidAbort];
00297                 [[CPRunLoop currentRunLoop] limitDateForMode:CPDefaultRunLoopMode];
00298             }
00299             [self _derefFromImage];
00300         }
00301 
00302     _image.src = _filename;
00303 
00304     // onload and friends may fire after this point but BEFORE the end of the run loop,
00305     // crazy, I know. So don't set isSynchronous here, rather wait a bit longer.
00306     window.setTimeout(function() { isSynchronous = NO; }, 0);
00307 }

- (unsigned) loadStatus   [implementation]

Returns the load status, which will be CPImageLoadStatusCompleted if the image data has already been loaded.
